data.job_description:
We are looking for a Marketing Analyst CE and MEA with high level of English

Client Details

At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.

PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.

In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally.

Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre

Description

About this role

The Marketing Analyst will be an integral role to support the needs of our CE & MEA Channel Marketing team and markets. This is a critical role to support measurement and optimisation of our marketing programme in CE & MEA. The goal is to provide data-driven insights that drive business growth, improve marketing efficiency, and enhance customer experiences.

This is a specialist role that sits on the business' Global Marketing Analyst team that supports delivery of the future direction of marketing analytics within the business, as well as the CE & MEA Channel Marketing Leadership team.

You will:

Have overall responsibility for regional execution of the global marketing analytics strategy including:
‚Ä¢ Presenting accurate data to stakeholders through clear, actionable reports, and visualizations on Power BI or other visualization tools
‚Ä¢ Regular review and maintenance/optimization of key platforms, dashboards and reports - Power BI, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, etc.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain data processes from multiple data sources
‚Ä¢ Work with relational databases to ensure the validity of reported information.
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and correct data quality issues
‚Ä¢ Train the marketing organization on dashboard usage, supporting a data-driven mindset.
‚Ä¢ Drive the regional implementation of projects in the global data & analytics roadmap
‚Ä¢ Advise on suitable measurement strategies based on channel objectives - including but not limited to paid advertising, organic, paid search/social
‚Ä¢ Identify ways in which to improve analytical procedure to increase productivity and efficiency
‚Ä¢ Ensure alignment globally and a consistent measurement approach across all markets
‚Ä¢ Analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform digital marketing strategies, optimize campaigns and improve ROI
‚Ä¢ Track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as website traffic, social media engagement, various channel contribution, lead generation, and conversion rates to benchmark and evaluate campaign effectiveness.

Profile

What you will bring:
‚Ä¢ A genuine passion for digital analytics
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and data manipulation skills, problem-solving mind-set
‚Ä¢ Fluency in English. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ +3 years of experience in marketing analytics and campaign measurement
‚Ä¢ Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel, GA4, Google Big Query, GTM, Power BI, Google Looker Studio and SQL
‚Ä¢ Data visualisation / dashboard development experience
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of web analytics including customer segmentation, attribution modelling, and path analysis
‚Ä¢ The ability to analyse data from multiple online and offline sources and translate it into commercial actions
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a multinational environment with multiple stakeholders, global and local teams is advantageous.
‚Ä¢ The ability to communicate analytical insight to internal stakeholders at all levels of seniority
‚Ä¢ Display a high level of initiative, be self-motivated and eager to learn
‚Ä¢ Minimum of a Bachelor's degree required

Expected behaviours:
‚Ä¢ Collaborative
‚Ä¢ Proactive and intellectually curious
‚Ä¢ Pragmatic, diplomatic and flexible
‚Ä¢ Solution-focused and strong at problem-solving
‚Ä¢ Resilient - ability to not be put off by obstacles and resistance.
‚Ä¢ Able to manage multiple priorities, make trade-offs and set expectations
‚Ä¢ Culturally aware and international in outlook

Job Offer

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Grow your career in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options

Our client is looking for a Marketing Analyst to join the Channel Marketing team covering Central Europe, the Middle East & Africa, and the UK. This role is essential to driving measurement, insights, and optimization across regional marketing programs. By leveraging data, you will help enhance marketing effectiveness, support business growth, and improve customer experiences.

Your responsibilities and impact as a Marketing Analyst will include:

Lead the execution of the global marketing analytics strategy at a regional level.

Track and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) such as web traffic, lead generation, social media engagement, channel contribution, and conversion rates to assess campaign impact.

Power BI, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager).

Build and manage data processes integrating multiple data sources.

Ensure data accuracy when working with relational databases.

Identify and resolve data quality issues.

Provide training and guidance to marketing teams on analytics tools and dashboards to encourage data-driven decision-making.

Support the rollout of global data and analytics initiatives within the region.

Recommend appropriate measurement frameworks for different marketing channels (paid, organic, search, and social).

Ensure global alignment with standardized measurement practices.

Translate data into insights, identifying trends and opportunities to optimize marketing performance and return on investment (ROI).

Strong interest and passion for digital analytics.

Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken).

Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing analytics and campaign measurement.

Expertise with Microsoft Excel, GA4, Google BigQuery, GTM, Power BI, Google Looker Studio, and SQL.

Solid understanding of web analytics, customer segmentation, attribution modeling, and path analysis.

Ability to consolidate insights from online and offline data sources and translate them into business actions.

Strong communication skills to present analytical insights to senior and junior audiences alike.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher required.

Permanent and full-time contract

Health insurance (after 6 months)

Hybrid model (3 days per week on-site)

Office in Barcelona

ASAP

An international SSC widely acknowledged as an excellent service provider for companies all over Europe is looking for experts in finance, administration, marketing, IT, HR, and recruitment to join their hub in Barcelona. They offer a dynamic and multicultural environment with a team including talents from more than 30 different nationalities working on high-quality standards.

Barcelona

Performance Marketing & Customer Analytics

MID

Marketing Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d)

To support our team we are searching for a Marketing Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) to be based in our Barcelona office.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
‚Ä¢ Analyze customer journey behavior and generate findings into online marketing campaigns
‚Ä¢ Development and implementation of marketing attribution methodologies to accurately measure marketing channel contribution
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain data models, dashboards and automated reports to measure performance across channels such as SEA, SEO, Affiliate, Email, Performance Display
‚Ä¢ Partner with the data engineering team to improve data pipelines and ensure seamless integration of new data sources
‚Ä¢ Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data
‚Ä¢ Continuous optimization, monitoring, and quality checkups of already existing processes and daily business

WHO YOU ARE:
‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs degree in (business) informatics, mathematics, data science, economics/business administration, or another relevant field
‚Ä¢ 3 years+ work experience within a Marketing Analytical role, ideally within an e-commerce environment
‚Ä¢ Proven expertise in handling large datasets, attribution modeling, and deriving business-critical insights
‚Ä¢ Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python and with ETL workflows
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of reporting tools e.g. Tableau/Power BI
‚Ä¢ Strategic thinker with strong business acumen and the ability to connect data to broader commercial objectives
‚Ä¢ Result driven and high standards in quality and precision
‚Ä¢ You are a passionate, committed team player with a high degree of personal initiative
‚Ä¢ Fluent in Business English

WHAT WE OFFER
‚Ä¢ Up to 32 days of holiday, depending on the length of service, starting with 28 days (excluding public holidays and weekends)
‚Ä¢ Mobile office with up to 20% of your total contracted hours (job and position permitting)
‚Ä¢ 10 days/year of mobile office abroad in EU-countries (job and position permitting)
‚Ä¢ Language & e-learning courses
‚Ä¢ Staff discount of up to 30%
‚Ä¢ Flexible remuneration benefits (ticket restaurant, ticket transport and ticket child care (guarder√≠a))
‚Ä¢ Discounted membership for selected sports platforms & gyms
‚Ä¢ Private health insurance
‚Ä¢ Access to LinkedIn Learning
‚Ä¢ Individual support on mental health & well-being
‚Ä¢ Social Day
‚Ä¢ Employee Share Purchase Plan

WHO WE ARE

Mytheresa is one of the leading global digital luxury shopping platforms. Our unique digital experience is based on a sharp focus on high-end luxury shoppers, exclusive product and content offerings, leading technology and analytical platforms as well as high quality service operations.

Since January 2021 we are a listed company on the New York Stock Exchange. More than 1,900 employees from over 100 countries work passionately to provide the best shopping experience.

Creating a strong as well as a diverse and inclusive team is essential for Mytheresa. For us your expertise and motivation matter more than your individual walk of life. Mytheresa ensures a fast and equal hiring process.

Marketing Analyst (all genders)

United to grow leaders

in a digital world.

Marketing Analyst (all genders)
‚Ä¢ Full Time
‚Ä¢ Barcelona, Provinz Barcelona, Spanien
‚Ä¢ Diamond in the rough
‚Ä¢ Ray of sunshine

We‚Äôre looking for a data-driven Marketing Analyst to join our team. This full-time, remote position offers the opportunity to work directly with a diverse range of clients, helping them understand and optimise their marketing performance through actionable insights.

Sounds great?

Then apply to us!
About MSQ Data.

MSQ Data is a centralised data team that sits at the heart of MSQ, the UK‚Äôs fastest growing multi-disciplinary marcomms group. We are a growing team of market leading, best-in-class specialists, based in our HQ in Covent Garden. Working closely with all MSQ agencies, who may be providing CRM, media planning & buying, PR or specialist marketing services, we fuse the very best in data insight, smart tech and creativity to drive commercial leaps for its clients.

MSQ Data works in both the B2C and B2B sectors for clients such as Three Mobile, Royal Mail, CFA and Which?, developing data strategies, insights and MarTech solutions for delivery in the UK and worldwide.

We provide a highly supportive and stimulating environment for those who want to collaborate with other data specialists to create impactful and effective data solutions for clients.
What you do.
‚Ä¢ Helping clients understand and optimise their marketing performance through actionable insights.
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll be responsible for analysing and interpreting marketing data from multiple sources (such as Google/Adobe analytics, DV360, GoogleAds, Meta, SemRush and Brandwatch) building clear and insightful dashboards and presenting findings that drive strategic decisions
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll work closely with internal teams and clients to translate complex data into meaningful recommendations that enhance campaign effectiveness and overall business outcomes

What you bring along.

Key Requirements
‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì4 years in marketing analytics, including agency experience
‚Ä¢ Strong Power BI and Looker skills for dashboard development
‚Ä¢ Experience handling marketing data sources:
‚Ä¢ Paid media: Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, DV360
‚Ä¢ Programmatic platforms: The Trade Desk
‚Ä¢ Digital Analytics: Adobe Analytics and GA4
‚Ä¢ Organic channels: Google Search console, Sprout Social
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in marketing intelligence tools (e.g., SimilarWeb, SEMrush/Ahrefs)
‚Ä¢ Experience with social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Hootsuite Insights)

Core Competencies
‚Ä¢ Strong grasp of marketing metrics and KPIs
‚Ä¢ Ability to turn data into actionable insights
‚Ä¢ Excellent presentation, communication, and analytical skills
‚Ä¢ Hands on and adept at problem-solving
‚Ä¢ Comfortable in a fast-paced agency setting

Industry Knowledge
‚Ä¢ Understanding of marketing ecosystems and performance metrics
‚Ä¢ Awareness of marketing attribution and measurement challenges
‚Ä¢ Up to date with trends in marketing technology and analytics

Our DNA is digital. And yours?

We are the leading digital full-service agency in Germany.

We love innovative technology, creativity and our 400+ employees for what they achieve each day.

Everything we do is human-centered. That is how we achieve excellent results for users, our clients and ourselves.

Sounds good to you? Then go ahead and send us your online application or contact Marc from our recruiting team*

APPLY NOW

T +49 6131 57609 - 6600
‚Ä¢ We promise we won‚Äôt ask you any strange questions.

Scopely is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing Analytics team in Barcelona on a hybrid basis!

At Scopely, we care deeply about what we do and want to inspire play every day - whether in our work environments alongside our talented colleagues or through our deep connections with our communities of players. We are a global team of game lovers who are developing, publishing, and innovating the mobile games industry, connecting millions of people worldwide daily.

The Marketing Analytics team is responsible for executing the cross-portfolio analytics initiatives for Scopely‚Äôs User Acquisition teams.

What will you do?

As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will be part of the Marketing Analytics team which is responsible for executing the cross-portfolio analytics initiatives for Scopely‚Äôs User Acquisition teams.
‚Ä¢ Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behaviour of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions supporting our Marketing Leadership org.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with diverse marketing stakeholders to understand their needs and collect requirements
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Finance leadership team to bridge UA operations with Finance targets, which will set the strategy of UA budgeting cross portfolio
‚Ä¢ Surface valuable insights to ensure that the capital allocation strategy for our largest area of investment results in the highest and best outcome for the business
‚Ä¢ Collaborate and work closely with our data product, analytics engineering and data scientists teams to deliver insightful analyses and help build our data products that bring strategic fit, user value and business value.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development of predictive models to support better decision making around budget optimization.

What We‚Äôre Looking For
‚Ä¢ 3-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst - a background in performance marketing and mobile free-to-play gaming is strongly preferred
‚Ä¢ Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigor, hard-working and a good business intuition are a must!
‚Ä¢ Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities
‚Ä¢ Experience in attribution models, reactivation frameworks, Incrementality measurement and LTV, budget optimization & allocation and Governance models.
‚Ä¢ Preferred experience in applying marketing modeling techniques e.g. media mix modeling, time series forecasting, segmentation / clustering.
‚Ä¢ Advanced skills utilizing analytics tools and languages used to manipulate and export data in large data sets (SQL) and to analyze/automate (Python preferred / R) - exposure to Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Working Knowledge of visualization tools: Looker (Preferred), Qlikview, Tableau or PowerBI.
‚Ä¢ Strong presentation skills; ability to effectively communicate complex results throughout an organization
‚Ä¢ Bachelor Degree - Masters degree a plus - in a quantitative or scientific field such as Math/Stats, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or similar
‚Ä¢ A love or strong desire to work with mobile / games

Please ensure that the r√©sum√©/CV you attach is written in English.

At Scopely, we create games for everyone - and want to ensure that the people behind our games reflect that! We are committed to creating a diverse, supportive work environment where everyone is treated with respect. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join us & embrace the adventure!

About Us

Scopely is a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," ‚ÄúStar Trek‚Ñ¢ Fleet Command,‚Äù ‚ÄúStumble Guys,‚Äù ‚ÄúMARVEL Strike Force,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYahtzee¬Æ With Buddies,‚Äù among others.

Scopely creates, publishes, and live-operates immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer‚Ñ¢ experience across multiple platforms--from mobile, web, PC and beyond.

Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform Playgami that supports one of the most diversified portfolios in the games industry.

Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies,‚Äù Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting game experiences that players enjoy for years.

Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents.

Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 for $4.9 billion, and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy.

For more information on Scopely, visit: scopely.com

Notice to candidates: Scopely, Inc and its affiliates will never request payment or ask for financial information as a condition for applying to a position or receiving an offer of employment. All official Scopely, Inc. recruiters only use email domains that end with @scopely.com.

Our official website is www.scopely.com. Please only apply to positions posted on our official website and ensure the recruiter only communicates via the official email domain.

Should you have any questions or encounter any fraudulent requests/emails/websites, please immediately contact recruiting@scopely.com. Our job applicant privacy policies are available here: California Privacy Notice and EEA/UK Privacy Notice.

Employment at Scopely is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. Scopely does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

data.job_title: Paid Acquisition Marketing Analyst - VIE - Barc... Digital Marketing ¬∑ Barcelona ¬∑ Hybrid
data.job_description:
Digital Marketing ¬∑ Barcelona ¬∑ Hybrid
Paid Acquisition Marketing Analyst - VIE - Barcelona

This year marks 10 years since we launched the idea that simplifying our customers' lives is possible by offering an innovative solution that allows them to easily subscribe to, manage, and switch all types of contracts through a unique and intuitive platform.

In that time, we have supported more than 2 millions customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals and positioning ourselves as a highly efficient, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a rapidly growing market.

With over 900 employees across 3 locations, we are solidifying our position as a market leader in Europe. We are always on the lookout for talent ready to join a dedicated and motivated team driven by a meaningful project. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.

‚ö°Ô∏èAs a Paid Acquisition Analyst, you will :

Within the Paid Acquisition team (Marketing & Sales team department) and based in Barcelona, your mission is to drive, plan and execute new growth projects for the PPC team on all markets.

Your role consists of setting up, developing and scaling new paid acquisition levers to maintain high growth standards.

This is a strategic role for papernest since you will be working on new topics with high growth potential for all the markets as well as a great opportunity to learn go to market strategies and project management skills. Your role will cover several areas : digital marketing, cross team project management, SEA, data analysis and everything it takes to efficiently put in place and test new initiatives.

You will be the owner of the profitability of these initiatives being responsible for the KPIs of the e2e funnel, from acquisition costs to conversion rate to revenues.

1. Identify high potential growth projects :
‚Ä¢ Study new acquisition channels and/or market opportunities (internally or externally) like Google Ads, Meta Ads, Tik Tok, affiliation;
‚Ä¢ Structure your approach to prioritize those initiatives based on growth, impact, resources and other criteria;
‚Ä¢ Benchmark our competitors and others sectors to find the best practices.

2. Project Management:
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with the PPC team to launch projects with the right stakeholders;
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with other teams (Operations, Data, CRM etc.) to ensure the initiative have the right environment to perform;
‚Ä¢ Promote a test & learn dynamic to continuously improve the results of your tests.

3. Analyze :
‚Ä¢ Analyze daily and weekly performances (profitability, deep-dive analysis, actions, recommendations etc.);
‚Ä¢ Work closely with all teams (PPC and the others) to challenge the performances, propose improvement actions, and decide to scale/stop the initiatives.

About you :

To join us as a VIE, it is necessary to meet specific conditions that you can verify here.
‚Ä¢ Having attended engineering or a business school
‚Ä¢ Experience in analysis : you master Excel, SQL is a plus
‚Ä¢ Having an experience in marketing is an asset
‚Ä¢ Strong sense of ownership and project management
‚Ä¢ Great interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Bilingual in French and English, Spanish is a plus
‚Ä¢ Growth mindset: effectiveness, resilience to failures, dedication to the mission.

What We Offer :

Evolving in an international and inclusive environment: Everyone has their place at Papernest, and with over 46 different nationalities, it‚Äôs not uncommon for us to start a sentence in French and finish it in English or Spanish!

üí∏ Compensation & Partnerships: A monthly allowance defined by Business France, check for the amount in Spain, which is updated every quarter. Additionally, Papernest offers partnerships for various services in Barcelona (restaurants, sports, leisure, and healthcare centers).

ü©∫ Health & Transport: A health insurance plan, April, for hassle-free management of your healthcare expenses, with 100% reimbursement. To make your transition easier, we also cover 100% of your round-trip transportation costs.

üß≥ Luggage: No decision to make! Papernest covers 100% of your luggage fees (up to 150kg) so you can enjoy all the seasons in Barcelona.

üìà Career Development: For us, the VIE contract is a real stepping stone into professional life. We support your career ambitions by ensuring your learning and professional development throughout your experience with us.

‚ú® Home office: Enjoy 2 days of home office per week to optimize your focus and efficiency.

Hiring process:
‚Ä¢ First call with Eva, Talent Acquisition Partner (30 min) ;
‚Ä¢ Business case to evaluate your skills (2h) ;
‚Ä¢ Technical interview with Celeste, Growth Marketing Manager (1h) ;
‚Ä¢ Last interview with Giacomo, Chief Marketing Officer (30min).

Interested in this challenge? üôÇ

Don‚Äôt hesitate any longer‚Äîwe look forward to meeting you! Regardless of your gender, background, religion, sexual orientation, or disability, there‚Äôs a place for you with us. Our selection processes are designed to be inclusive, and our work environment is adapted to everyone‚Äôs needs.

We particularly encourage applications from women. Even if you feel that you don‚Äôt meet all the criteria outlined in this job posting, please know that every application is valuable. We strongly believe that diverse and varied backgrounds enrich our team, and we will carefully consider your application. Parity and diversity are essential assets to our success.

Department Digital Marketing Locations Barcelona Remote status Hybrid Employment type Full-time

Contact Eva Le Teuff Talent Acquisition Partner ‚Äì Human Resources

Join us

Barcelona

About papernest

At papernest, we believe life is too short for paperwork.

Our free digital platform allows users to centralize, optimize, subscribe to, and cancel all their contracts in just a few clicks: electricity, internet, insurance, and more. And this is only the beginning. From streaming services to everyday essentials, we're building tools that return time and peace of mind.

Paid Acquisition Marketing Analyst - VIE - Barcelona

Already working at papernest ?

Let‚Äôs recruit together and find your next colleague.

The Alpega Group is looking for a Marketing RevOps Data Analyst. This position will be based in Barcelona, Spain.

Who Are We

The Alpega Group is a fast-growing, leading software company that offers modular solutions to manage transportation end-to-end and enable our customers to achieve greener transportation processes, with 35+ years in the business.

Find More About Our Clients And Services Here

Alpega Group: control your supply chain with Alpega TMS.

Freight Exchange (alpegagroup.com)

About The Role

As a‚ÄØMarketing RevOps Data Analyst,‚ÄØyou will be a key technical enabler within the organisation, responsible for all data that powers prospecting, funnel progression, and pipeline growth. This is a new role within the Marketing team, created to build and evolve Alpega‚Äôs data architecture, ensuring we use clean, unified, actionable data that drives revenue impact.

Why This Role Matters

Role

This is a newly created, strategic role that will directly influence how Alpega understands, activates, and grows its market. By improving our data architecture (across HubSpot, Salesforce, and BI systems), you will:
‚Ä¢ Build the foundations of the One Growth Engine
‚Ä¢ Enable cleaner data, better attribution, and stronger funnel insights
‚Ä¢ Improve automation and reduce manual work across teams
‚Ä¢ Directly impact pipeline creation and revenue acceleration in 2026 and beyond
‚Ä¢ Shape how Marketing & Sales collaborate through data
‚Ä¢ You won‚Äôt just manage data, you‚Äôll architect how we grow.

Your mission:‚ÄØBuild the analytical backbone that will support our One Growth Engine, aligning Marketing & Sales systems, improving data quality, enabling automation, and strengthening decision-making across the business.

Key Responsibilities Include
‚Ä¢ Data Governance & Quality: Audit and cleanse CRM data, enforce naming conventions, manage enrichment tools, and ensure GDPR compliance.
‚Ä¢ Data Integration & Harmonisation: Align HubSpot and Salesforce data structures, maintain sync rules, troubleshoot errors, and support sandbox testing.
‚Ä¢ Reporting & Analytics: Build centralised dashboards, automate QBR visuals, and provide clean datasets for BI tools like Tableau or Looker Studio.
‚Ä¢ Campaign Support: Create segmented lists, standardise UTMs, and analyse multi-touch attribution.
‚Ä¢ Process Optimisation: Identify automation opportunities, document workflows, and train users on data best practices.

What We Look For In You
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in Revenue Operations, CRM Administration, or Data Analytics (ideally SaaS)
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, and intermediate SQL
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with data governance, GDPR, and compliance
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of marketing & sales funnels, data modelling, and KPI structures
‚Ä¢ Strong technical proficiency in HubSpot and Salesforce

KPIs / SUCCESS INDICATORS
‚Ä¢ Reduction of duplicate/mismatched CRM records
‚Ä¢ Faster, more reliable HubSpot ‚Üî Salesforce data sync
‚Ä¢ Improved accuracy of dashboards, QBR packages, and pipeline reports
‚Ä¢ Increased stakeholder confidence in data quality and reporting
‚Ä¢ Adoption of unified dashboards across Growth, Sales, Events, and leadership

What We Offer
‚Ä¢ Hybrid work model with flexibility (Barcelona / Sant Cugat)
‚Ä¢ Permanent contract
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to shape a brand-new function within the Marketing organisation
‚Ä¢ A front-row seat in transforming our data architecture and GTM engine
‚Ä¢ Exposure to international teams and cross-functional collaboration

Learn more about About us | Alpega

Our commitment to you

The Alpega Group has 500 collaborators with over 40 nationalities, based in our different locations. We are a global team, with different backgrounds, races, faiths and genders. We commit to ensuring that everyone feels included, has opportunities to learn and grow and is happy at work.

If you require any additional support with your application, reach out to the Talent Acquisition specialist for this position, so we can make arrangements for you.

Good luck with your application! We look forward to hearing from you.

What Is Exoticca?
Exoticca is a pioneering online travel agency that has revolutionized the conception, production, and e-commerce of long-distance dream trips. At the core of Exoticca's brand equity is the commitment to "creating life milestones." We believe in delivering best-value trips, exploring unique destinations, curating extraordinary travel experiences, and demonstrating genuine care for both our customers and the planet.

We are a professional, dynamic, multicultural team in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.

Who we are?
As our Trade Marketing Analyst (B2B), you will be the central executor for our global business-to-business marketing initiatives. This is a hands-on role focused on seamless execution and cross-functional coordination.

You will manage the end-to-end campaign workflow, acting as the main point of contact for internal teams (Design, Copywriting, Branding) and external partners. Your responsibilities include developing creative concepts, designing materials, managing content uploads (CMS), and ensuring all projects are delivered on time and maintain high quality.

We seek a proactive, resourceful, and detail-oriented analyst ready to provide insights that drive campaign performance and B2B growth.

What will you do?
‚Ä¢ Coordinate B2B Marketing campaigns: work with external partners and internal teams to implement and deliver successful marketing initiatives
‚Ä¢ Cross-team collaboration: act as the main point of contact between Design, Copywriting, and Branding teams to ensure smooth execution of projects
‚Ä¢ Design and creation Marketing materials: develop creative concepts and design marketing materials that align with brand guidelines and campaigns goals.
‚Ä¢ Manage content uploads: oversee the creation, organization and uploading of materials to our CMS, ensuring proper design standards
‚Ä¢ Project management: ensure timely delivery of materials, maintaining quality and meeting deadlines
‚Ä¢ Support campaign strategy: collaborate with teams and partners to refine and enhance marketing strategies, including presentations, newsletters, and other marketing assets
‚Ä¢ Provide insights: share feedback and insights to help improve and optimize the campaign‚Äôs performance and marketing strategies

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills: ability to communicate clearly, both in writing and verbally.
‚Ä¢ Proactive & Organized: you can work independently, manage time well, and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
‚Ä¢ Creative problem solver: you generate fresh ideas and solutions to enhance marketing initiatives
‚Ä¢ Tech-savvy: proficient in Excel, Google Analytics, and Microsoft Office.
Advanced skills in Adobe Suite, InDesign, Canva, and Photoshop.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English: Strong written and spoken English (C1 level).
